name: Coffin Queen
text:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

name: Cognivore
text:
Flying
Cognivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of instant cards in all graveyards.

name: Cogwork Assembler
text: {7}: Create a token that's a copy of target artifact. That token gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: Duplication is neither thievery nor flattery. It is efficiency.

name: Cogworker's Puzzleknot
text:
When Cogworker's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Cogworker's Puzzleknot: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

name: Cogwork Grinder
text:
Draft Cogwork Grinder face up.
As you draft a card, you may remove it from the draft face down. (Those cards aren't in your card pool.)
Cogwork Grinder enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of cards you removed from the draft with cards named Cogwork Grinder.

name: Cogwork Librarian
text:
Draft Cogwork Librarian face up.
As you draft a card, you may draft an additional card from that booster pack. If you do, put Cogwork Librarian into that booster pack.

editions.flavor: Why wait for answers?

name: Cogwork Spy
text:
Reveal Cogwork Spy as you draft it. You may look at the next card drafted from this booster pack.
Flying

editions.flavor: Paliano's creations provide ample opportunities to plot the downfall of a neighbor.

name: Cogwork Tracker
text:
Reveal Cogwork Tracker as you draft it and note the player who passed it to you.
Cogwork Tracker attacks each turn if able.
Cogwork Tracker attacks a player you noted for cards named Cogwork Tracker each turn if able.

name: Coiled Tinviper
text: First strike

editions.flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.
The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.

name: Coiling Oracle
text: When Coiling Oracle enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.

editions.flavor: Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.
Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.
Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.
Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.

"Nature was slowly heading in the right direction, but we know how to achieve faster results."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade
Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.

name: Coiling Woodworm
text: Coiling Woodworm's power is equal to the number of Forests on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Only the elves know where the woods end and the woodworm begins.

name: Coils of the Medusa
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1.
Sacrifice Coils of the Medusa: Destroy all non-Wall creatures blocking enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Serpentine locks shape ornate rocks.

name: Cold-Eyed Selkie
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Cold-Eyed Selkie deals combat damage to a player, you may draw that many cards.

editions.flavor: She follows the old tributaries built when merrows still shaped the tides.
She follows the old tributaries built when merrows still shaped the tides.
She follows the old tributaries built when merrows still shaped the tides.

name: Cold Snap
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Cold Snap deals damage to that player equal to the number of snow lands he or she controls.

editions.flavor: Who knows from whence the winter comes?

name: Coldsteel Heart
text:
Coldsteel Heart enters the battlefield tapped.
As Coldsteel Heart enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The Phyrexian death machine awoke, its coldsteel heart imbuing it with sinister new power.
The Phyrexian death machine awoke, its coldsteel heart imbuing it with sinister new power.

name: Cold Storage
text:
{3}: Exile target creature you control.
Sacrifice Cold Storage: Return each creature card exiled with Cold Storage to the battlefield under your control.

name: Colfenor's Plans
text:
When Colfenor's Plans enters the battlefield, exile the top seven cards of your library face down.
You may look at and play cards exiled with Colfenor's Plans.
Skip your draw step.
You can't cast more than one spell each turn.

name: Colfenor's Urn
text:
Whenever a creature with toughness 4 or greater is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may exile it.
At the beginning of the end step, if three or more cards have been exiled with Colfenor's Urn, sacrifice it. If you do, return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.

name: Collapsing Borders
text: Domain — At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains 1 life for each basic land type among lands he or she controls. Then Collapsing Borders deals 3 damage to him or her.

name: Collateral Damage
text:
As an additional cost to cast Collateral Damage, sacrifice a creature.
Collateral Damage deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: It is much easier to create fire than to contain it.

name: Collected Company
text: Look at the top six cards of your library. Put up to two creature cards with converted mana cost 3 or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: Many can stand where one would fall.

name: Collective Blessing
text: Creatures you control get +3/+3.

editions.flavor: Senators of Azorius often hired agents to spy on the Selesnya. They were told to record every spore and root they saw, as each could become a deadly foe.

name: Collective Brutality
text:
Escalate—Discard a card. (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it. That player discards that card.
• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
• Target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

name: Collective Defiance
text:
Escalate {1} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.
• Collective Defiance deals 4 damage to target creature.
• Collective Defiance deals 3 damage to target opponent.

name: Collective Effort
text:
Escalate—Tap an untapped creature you control. (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature target player controls.

name: Collective Restraint
text: Domain — Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {X} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

name: Collective Unconscious
text: Draw a card for each creature you control.

editions.flavor: "The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."
Gerrard knew little of Ramos, the sky god they worshiped. But he felt the power of the chant.
"The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."

name: Collective Voyage
text: Join forces — Starting with you, each player may pay any amount of mana. Each player searches his or her library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the total amount of mana paid this way, puts them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffles his or her library.

name: Collector Protector
text: {W}, Give an opponent a nonland card you own from outside the game: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you or Collector Protector this turn.

editions.flavor: "Here—have a Mudhole."

name: Colossal Heroics
text:
Strive — Colossal Heroics costs {1}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn. Untap those creatures.

name: Colossal Might
text: Target creature gets +4/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Never corner a barbarian. You become the path of least resistance."
—Sarkhan Vol

"Never corner a barbarian. You become the path of least resistance."
—Sarkhan Vol

"Never corner a barbarian. You become the path of least resistance."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Colossal Whale
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Colossal Whale attacks, you may exile target creature defending player controls until Colossal Whale leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

editions.flavor: The colossodon's hard outer shell stops many predators, but with a gentle flip from a dragon, it quickly becomes a meal in a bowl.

name: Colossus of Akros
text:
Defender, indestructible
{10}: Monstrosity 10. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put ten +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
As long as Colossus of Akros is monstrous, it has trample and can attack as though it didn't have defender.

name: Colossus of Sardia
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

editions.flavor:
From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom:
Warrior born from a rocky womb.

From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom:
Warrior born from a rocky womb.
From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom: / Warrior born from a rocky womb.
Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.
Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.

name: Colos Yearling
text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
{R}: Colos Yearling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A steed grows with its rider.

name: Coma Veil
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor: Etherium does not know sleep. Only magic can teach it the resting state of cold steel.

name: Combat Medic
text: {1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Without combat medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

"Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

"Although Icatia's Combat Medics borrowed much of their knowledge from other societies, their skills were their own."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

"We'd no sooner knock 'em back on their heels than that accursed sawbones would show up and patch 'em back together again."
—Ivra Jursdotter

"Time enough to become a Medic once you're hurt too badly to fight. For now, Icatia needs your strength more than your compassion."
—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

"Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

name: Combust
text:
Combust can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Combust deals 5 damage to target white or blue creature. The damage can't be prevented.

name: Combustible Gearhulk
text:
First strike
When Combustible Gearhulk enters the battlefield, target opponent may have you draw three cards. If the player doesn't, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard, then Combustible Gearhulk deals damage to that player equal to the total converted mana cost of those cards.

name: Comet Storm
text:
Multikicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Choose target creature or player, then choose another target creature or player for each time Comet Storm was kicked. Comet Storm deals X damage to each of them.

name: Comeuppance
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and planeswalkers you control this turn by sources you don't control. If damage from a creature source is prevented this way, Comeuppance deals that much damage to that creature. If damage from a noncreature source is prevented this way, Comeuppance deals that much damage to the source's controller.

name: Command Beacon
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Command Beacon: Put your commander into your hand from the command zone.

editions.flavor: "I gazed once into that light. Now it burns in my mind, forever denying me rest."—Riku of Two Reflections

"I gazed once into that light. Now it burns in my mind, forever denying me rest."
—Riku of Two Reflections

name: Commandeer
text:
You may exile two blue cards from your hand rather than pay Commandeer's mana cost.
Gain control of target noncreature spell. You may choose new targets for it. (If that spell is an artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker, the permanent enters the battlefield under your control.)

name: Commander Eesha
text: Flying, protection from creatures

editions.flavor: "War glides on the simplest updrafts while peace struggles against hurricane winds. It is the way of the world. It must change."

name: Commander Greven il-Vec
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.

editions.flavor: "Rage is the only freedom left to me."

"Rage is the only freedom left me."
—Greven il-Vec

name: Commander's Authority
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 white Human creature token."

editions.flavor: "Wear her symbol with honor, a sign of faith upheld and honest deeds bravely done."

name: Commander's Sphere
text:
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: It harmonizes with the essence of its master.
It harmonizes with the essence of its master.

name: Command of Unsummoning
text:
Cast Command of Unsummoning only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return one or two target attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

name: Commando Raid
text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature that player controls."

name: Command Tower
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.

editions.flavor: When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.

name: Commencement of Festivities
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to players this turn.

editions.flavor: Never before have there been so many brilliant minds and wondrous inventions in one place. Denizens from every corner of Kaladesh will flock to the once-in-a-lifetime Inventors' Fair.

name: Common Bond
text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: Wolf riders hone their skills traversing the perilous rooftops, each dizzying step bringing elf and wolf closer together.

name: Common Cause
text: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.

editions.flavor: Mercadia City's troops are at their best when they have no enemy to fight.

name: Common Courtesy
text: Counter any spell unless its caster asks your permission to play that spell. If you refuse permission, Sacrifice Common Courtesy and counter the spell.

editions.flavor: "You didn't say the Magic word."

name: Commune with Lava
text: Exile the top X cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.

editions.flavor: Atarka conquered Qadat, the Fire Rim, long ago, winning over its efreet with a promise to spread the glory of fire to all the world.

name: Commune with Nature
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Commune with the Gods
text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or enchantment card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: For the first time in many years, Elspeth asked for help.
For the first time in many years, Elspeth asked for help.

name: Comparative Analysis
text:
Surge {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Target player draws two cards.

editions.flavor:
"Our time grows short. If we wish to vanquish the Eldrazi, we must unlock the hedrons' secrets."
—Jace Beleren

name: Compelling Deterrence
text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card if you control a Zombie.

editions.flavor: "So much for neighborly hospitality!"
"So much for neighborly hospitality!"

name: Complete Disregard
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Exile target creature with power 3 or less.

editions.flavor: "We returned to the field and found poor Len, every detail of his final moment perfectly cast in that awful dust."—Javad Nasrin, outrider captain

name: Complex Automaton
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control seven or more permanents, return Complex Automaton to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"This wasteful design cannot possibly be Phyrexian."
—Belbe

name: Complicate
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Complicate, you may counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

name: Composite Golem
text: Sacrifice Composite Golem: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: It binds the five suns in human form.
An artificer's experiment in cross-material engineering found its own purpose as an interpreter between cultures.

name: Compost
text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

name: Compulsion
text:
{1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
{1}{U}, Sacrifice Compulsion: Draw a card.

name: Compulsive Research
text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless he or she discards a land card.

editions.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"
"Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"
"Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

text:
Concealed Courtyard enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Where high society and dark opportunity intersect.

name: Concentrate
text: Draw three cards.

editions.flavor: "The treasure in my mind is greater than any worldly glory."

"The treasure in my mind is greater than any worldly glory."

name: Concerted Effort
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if a creature you control has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, landwalk, protection, trample, and vigilance.

name: Conch Horn
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Conch Horn: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on top of your library.

editions.flavor: Even the most skilled of modern mages only partially understand the Conch Horn's awesome powers.

name: Conclave Equenaut
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Flying

editions.flavor: Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.
Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.

name: Conclave Naturalists
text: When Conclave Naturalists enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "Your swords and wards have no power here."
"Your swords and wards have no power here."

name: Conclave Phalanx
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
When Conclave Phalanx enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

name: Conclave's Blessing
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Enchant creature

name: Concordant Crossroads
text: All creatures have haste.

name: Concordia Pegasus
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"A kick from its hooves is like a bolt of lightning. I'd know. I've been hit by both."
—Rencz, Izzet chemister's aide

name: Concussive Bolt
text:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.

name: Condemn
text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Conduit of Emrakul
text: Whenever Conduit of Emrakul attacks, add {C}{C} to your mana pool at the beginning of your next main phase this turn.

editions.flavor: As without, so within.

name: Conduit of Ruin
text:
When you cast Conduit of Ruin, you may search your library for a colorless creature card with converted mana cost 7 or greater, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {2} less to cast.

name: Conduit of Storms
text:
Whenever Conduit of Storms attacks, add {R} to your mana pool at the beginning of your next main phase this turn.
{3}{R}{R}: Transform Conduit of Storms.

editions.flavor: It strikes with the fury of a tempest.

name: Cone of Flame
text: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Mine is not the warmth of compassion."
—Ertai, wizard adept

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Confessor
text: Whenever a player discards a card, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "There will be gains for our losses. There will be rights for our wrongs."

name: Confirm Suspicions
text:
Counter target spell.
Investigate three times. (To investigate, create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor: Everyone has something to hide.

name: Confiscate
text:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.

editions.flavor:
"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis

"It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected."
—Mark Twain, More Maxims of Mark

"I don't understand why he works so hard on a device to duplicate a sound so easily made with hand and armpit."
—Barrin, progress report

name: Confiscation Coup
text: Choose target artifact or creature. You get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters), then you may pay an amount of {E} equal to that permanent's converted mana cost. If you do, gain control of it.

editions.flavor: "Citizens, do not resist. This is for your safety. Tezzeret bids you to surrender your inventions. Now."

name: Conflagrate
text:
Conflagrate deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Flashback—{R}{R}, Discard X cards. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Conflux
text: Search your library for a white card, a blue card, a black card, a red card, and a green card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: After years of world-bending machinations, Bolas's triumph is at hand.

"It's self-indulgent, I admit, but I do like to watch my own symphony play itself out."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Confound
text:
Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Did I know Szat would betray us?" Urza asked quizzically. "I was counting on it."

name: Confront the Unknown
text: Investigate, then target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Clue you control. (To investigate, create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor:
"Never flinch from the truth."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Confusion in the Ranks
text: Whenever an artifact, creature, or enchantment enters the battlefield, its controller chooses target permanent another player controls that shares a card type with it. Exchange control of those permanents.

name: Congregate
text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

—Song of All, canto 642

name: Congregation at Dawn
text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and reveal them. Shuffle your library, then put those cards on top of it in any order.

editions.flavor: "It is fitting that we meet in the first hour of light, for we are called by the Conclave to pierce a threat of darkness."

name: Conifer Strider
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Atarka's presence thaws the glaciers of Qal Sisma, forcing its elementals to migrate or adapt.

name: Conjured Currency
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exchange control of Conjured Currency and target permanent you neither own nor control.

editions.flavor: A bargain in Keyhole Downs is always too good to be true.

name: Conjurer's Ban
text:
Name a card. Until your next turn, the named card can't be played.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Orzhov faithful file past to have their minds purged of "impure" desires. There, the guiltwardens eliminate any thoughts of hope or self-sufficiency.

name: Conjurer's Bauble
text: {T}, Sacrifice Conjurer's Bauble: Put up to one target card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library. Draw a card.

editions.flavor: It is the moment of discovery, the triumph of the mind, the reimagining of past glory.

name: Conjurer's Closet
text: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor:
"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."
—Kordel the Cryptic
